meanings.definition: To produce a ringing, metallic sound.
meanings.sent1: I heard the metal gate twangle in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The wind chimes twangle softly in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The old bicycle bell would twangle whenever someone rode by.
meanings.sent4: The keys on the keychain twangle like tiny bells.
meanings.sent5: The twangling of the wind chimes filled the quiet garden.

meanings.sent1: The twangle of the guitar strings filled the room.
meanings.sent2: The twangle of the banjo added a lively rhythm to the music.
meanings.sent3: The twangle of the doorbell made the dog bark excitedly.
meanings.sent4: The twangle of the wind chimes echoed through the house.
meanings.sent5: The sudden twangle of the alarm clock woke me up abruptly.

meanings.definition: To play a stringed instrument with a twanging sound.
meanings.sent1: She would twangle the guitar strings with skillful fingers.
meanings.sent2: The musician began to twangle the ukulele, filling the room with music.
meanings.sent3: He tried to twangle the violin but ended up making a screeching noise.
meanings.sent4: The street performer would twangle the guitar for hours, entertaining passersby.
meanings.sent5: The children gathered around to watch him twangle the strings of the harp.
